net.dean.jraw.http

Class HttpRequest.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dean.jraw.http.HttpRequest.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    HttpRequest

    public static final class HttpRequest.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides an interface to create objects that model HTTP requests. Each property method will return itself for method chaining. Borrowed heavily from OkHttp's Request.Builder class.

    • Constructor Summary

      • from

        public static HttpRequest.Builder from(java.lang.String method,
                       java.net.URL url,
                       java.lang.Object... formArgs)
        Creates a new Builder that will result in a RestRequest whose URL will match the one given
        Parameters:
        method - The HTTP verb
        url - The URL to parse
        formArgs - An optional array of Strings to send as form data
        Returns:
        A new Builder that represents the given URL

      • method

        public HttpRequest.Builder method(java.lang.String method,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> urlEncodedForm)
        Sets the HTTP verb to use for this request. A full list can be found in RFC 2616. The Content-Type for this request will be application/x-www-form-urlencoded.
        Parameters:
        method - The name of the method (GET, POST, etc.)
        urlEncodedForm - A map that will be encoded using UTF-8. Can be null.
        Returns:
        This Builder

      • method

        public HttpRequest.Builder method(java.lang.String method,
                         RequestBody body)
        Sets the HTTP verb to use for this request. A full list can be found in RFC 2616.
        Parameters:
        method - The name of the method (GET, POST, etc.)
        body - The request body. Can be null.
        Returns:
        This Bulider

      • https

        public HttpRequest.Builder https(boolean https)
        Enables or disables HTTPS

      • host

        public HttpRequest.Builder host(java.lang.String host)
        Sets the target URL's host. For example, "github.com."

      • path

        public HttpRequest.Builder path(java.lang.String path,
                       java.lang.String... params)
        Sets the URL's path. For example, "/thatJavaNerd/JRAW." Positional path parameters are supported, so if path was "/api/{resource}" and params was a one-element array consisting of "foo", then the resulting path would be "/api/foo."
        Parameters:
        path - The path. If null, "/" will be used.
        params - Optional positional path parameters
        Returns:
        This Builder

      • endpoint

        public HttpRequest.Builder endpoint(Endpoints e,
                           java.lang.String... pathParams)
        Calls path(String, String...) with e.getEndpoint().getUri()

      • query

        public HttpRequest.Builder query(java.lang.String... keysAndValues)
        Sets the arguments to be used in the query string. This will be appended after the path in the format ?key=value&foo=bar.
        Parameters:
        keysAndValues - Passed to JrawUtils.mapOf(Object...)
        Returns:
        This Builder

      • query

        public HttpRequest.Builder query(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> query)
        Sets the arguments to be used in the query string. This will be appended after the path in the format ?key=value&foo=bar.
        Returns:
        This Builder

      • cacheControl

        public HttpRequest.Builder cacheControl(com.squareup.okhttp.CacheControl cacheControl)
        Sets how the server should go about finding a cached version of this request
        Parameters:
        cacheControl - The value of the Cache-Control header. If null or empty, the the header is removed.

      • basicAuth

        public HttpRequest.Builder basicAuth(BasicAuthData data)
        Sets the username and password to be used with HTTP Basic Authentication. HTTPS must be enabled before build() is called in order for to avoid an exception.
        See Also:
        https(boolean)

      • expected

        public HttpRequest.Builder expected(com.google.common.net.MediaType type)
        Sets the expected value of the response's Content-Type header

      • sensitiveArgs

        public HttpRequest.Builder sensitiveArgs(java.lang.String... args)
        Notes that the the values of the given keys should be kept secret. Only applies if the body is x-www-form-urlencoded. Note that this is honored by HttpLogger, third party classes might not. If you are unsure about security, it is best to disable logging HTTP requests and enable HTTPS by default.
        See Also:
        HttpLogger.log(HttpRequest), HttpClient.setHttpsDefault(boolean)

      • build

        public HttpRequest build()
        Compiles all the data given from other property methods into a HttpRequest
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If a malformed URL is created, HTTP Basic Authentication is enabled but HTTPS is not, or an essential piece of information is missing, like the host.
